definition: to raise one's foot/to stand on tiptoe/stilts

sentences.english: If you plan on not attending class, make sure you have a buddy that will sign u in.
sentences.chinese: 要是你打算蹺課，先保證有個傢夥能幫你簽到。

sentences.english: Although some of my daughter's friends cut class a lot, she is at school everyday.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我女兒的朋友經常蹺課，她可是每天都上學。

sentences.english: And the Mirage is such a great place to hang out.
sentences.chinese: 而這樣一個偉大的地方是幻影蹺課。

sentences.english: I feel like ditching this class.
Just hang out all those Negative Thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些負面的想法只是蹺課。

sentences.english: The schoolboy is often cutting classes and playing hooky.
sentences.chinese: 那男生經常蹺課和逃學。

sentences.english: More and more students are cutting classes these days.
sentences.chinese: 最近愈來愈多學生蹺課了。

definition: the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
calculus/differentiation and integration/calculus of infinitesimals 微 and integrals 積|积
to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to skip work/to sneak out of work early
to talk endlessly on the phone
